alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Carter; Greenup; Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 9:48AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Gusty winds and moderate to locally heavy rain will impact portions of Boyd, Greenup, Carter, northern Lawrence, Meigs, Lawrence, Gallia, Jackson, southeastern Vinton, northwestern Wayne, west central Wood, northwestern Mason and northwestern Cabell Counties through 1100 AM EST... At 944 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking moderate to occasionally heavy rain, along with gusty winds, moving into the area. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Ironton, Jackson, Grayson, Gallipolis, Olive Hill, Oak Hill, Rio Grande, Rutland, and Cannonsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Moderate rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams, and ponding of water in urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas and low lying spots.
